oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Admiral David Glasgow Farragut
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: David Glasgow Farragut was born in 1801 in Campbell's Station, Tennessee. Despite his young age, he served in the War of 1812. He later served in the West Indies and the Mexican-American War, though he is best known for his service in the Civil War. Farragut holds the distinction of being the first rear admiral, vice admiral, and admiral in the United States Navy. Campbell's Station was later renamed Farragut in his honor.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Men; Admirals; Military Officers
